intro: Gymnosporia harveyana subsp. harveyana, commonly known as the Harvey's gymnosporia, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant produces small, spherical fruits that contain a single seed, typical of many gymnosporia species. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and coastal areas. Its ecological role includes providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
